name: Classic Clam Chowder
author: Ben S.
summary: Give leftover mashed potatoes a second life: Make a pot of clam chowder.
ingredients: 2 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into small dice
1 large onion, cut into medium dice
4 (6.5 ounce) cans minced clams (clams and juice separated)
directions: In a large soup kettle, fry bacon over medium heat until bacon crisps, about 5 minutes
Keep 2 tablespoons bacon fat in pan
(If necessary, add oil to yield 2 tablespoons
) Add onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes
Add thyme and bay leaves; cook until fragrant, 30 seconds or so
Whisk in mashed potatoes, clam juice (bottled and what you've drained from the clams) and 1 cup of water
Add new potatoes and bring to a simmer
Reduce heat; continue to simmer, partially covered, until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes
Stir in clams, cream and parsley; season with salt and pepper
Heat through and serve, garnishing each bowl with reserved bacon
